author: juneb
body:
In PowerShell 1-5, Get-Help displays command parameters in the order that they are defined. In PowerShell 6 alpha, they are displayed in what looks like an arbitrary order (not alphabetical), as though they're stored in a hash table.

Scripters have learned to define parameters in order of importance and to group related parameters. This arbitrary order makes it difficult for users to gain an intuitive understanding of the parameters and their use.

```

function Test-ParameterHelp
{
    param
    (
        [Parameter(Mandatory = $false,
                   ValueFromPipeline = $true,
                   Position = 0)]
        [SupportsWildcards()]
        # [PSDefaultValue(Help = 'Current location', Value='$PWD')]
        [string]
        $Path = $PWD,


        [Alias('UID')]
        [int]
        $ID = 0
    )

    $null = Get-ChildItem $Path
}

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.11> Get-Help Test-ParameterHelp -Parameter *

-ID <int>

    Required?                    false
    Position?                    Named
    Accept pipeline input?       false
    Parameter set name           (All)
    Aliases                      UID
    Dynamic?                     false


-aPath <string>

    Required?                    false
    Position?                    0
    Accept pipeline input?       true (ByValue)
    Parameter set name           (All)
    Aliases                      None
    Dynamic?                     false
```
title: Get-Help displays parameter in arbitrary order
